intro: Pimpinella cappadocica var. iberica, commonly known as the Iberian cress, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Its seeds are used in traditional herbal remedies and are valued for their aromatic properties.
